location: England, Buckinghamshire Downs Barn, Milton Keynes
description: A Late Iron Age enclosed domestic site. Among domestic features was found a rectangular stone surface made of limestone slabs surrounded by areas of burning and a deposit of burn pig remains. Very tentatively interpreted as ritual by the excavators, and the Rural Settlement of Roman Britain project went further in categorising it as a 'shrine'.
bibliography: Last. “Late Iron Age Features at Reserve Site 5, Downs Barn, Milton Keynes.” Records of Buckinghamshire 41 (2001).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Reserve Site 5, Downs Barn, Milton Keynes (Buckinghamshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
